content.description: Figure 1 shows the formation of maltose (a disaccharide) from two glucose molecules.
content.question: Figure 1. Diagram of the formation of maltose Which of the following statements best describes the molecular changes that occur during the reaction shown in Figure 1?

choices.label: Two hydroxyl groups are removed from each glucose molecule, and one water molecule is formed.
A water molecule is added to the hydroxyl groups to form the covalent bond between the two glucose molecules.
A hydroxyl group from one glucose molecule and a hydrogen atom from the other glucose molecule are removed, and one water molecule is formed.
A hydrogen atom in one glucose molecule and a hydroxyl group in the other glucose molecule form a hydrogen bond.

content.answer: A hydroxyl group from one glucose molecule and a hydrogen atom from the other glucose molecule are removed, and one water molecule is formed.
